p: In order to verify the possible modifications of the skin parameters after exposure to the hydro-alcoholic basil extracts, in vivo evaluation was performed on healthy human skin. As presented in Figure 5, no important modification of the main skin parameters was found during these tests: the level of the transepidermal water loss (TEWL) has changed with just around 2.5 g/m 2/h in the case of both extracts while the modification was approx. 1.5 units for the reference; the melanin has increased with around 60 units for both extracts and 30 units for reference, but it is important to know that its scale is large, ranging between 0 and 999 units.
